00207 /*
00208 @endcode
00209 @page knobs Driver Tweaks
00210 This is a summary of device driver tweaks.
00211 -/sys/module/acq200_hostdrv/parameters/
00212  - acq200_debug_mbox\n
00213         set non-zero to debug mailbox transactions
00214  - acq200_hostdrv_debug\n
00215         set greater than zero to debug driver in general
00216  - acq200_stub_copy_to_user\n
00217         set non-zero for performance test [do not use]
00218  - acq200_use_interrupts\n
00219         set zero to disable interrupts [do not use]
00220  - slots\n
00221         maps logical device to CPCI slot#
00222 
00223 -/sys/class/acqX00/acq200.L/device/ \n
00224         where L is the logical device number 0..
00225  - available_input_channels
00226  - available_output_channels
00227  - cpci_slot
00228  - heartbeat\n
00229         non-zero value indicates "card is alive"
00230  - host_len\n
00231         host buffer length
00232  - host_pa\n
00233         host buffer physical [bus] address
00234  - interrupt_count
00235  - irq
00236  - pool
00237  - subsystem_device
00238  - subsystem_vendor
00239 
00240 <!-- /README --> */

00322 struct Acq200Device* acq200_lookupDevice(struct device *dev)
00323 {
00324         int id;
00325 
00326         for (id = 0; id < idx; ++id){
00327                 struct Acq200Device* acq200_device = devices[id];
00328                 if (dev == &devices[id]->pci_dev->dev){
00329                         return acq200_device;
00330                 }
00331         }
00332         
00333         return 0;
00334 }
00335 
00336 struct Acq200Device *acq200_lookupDeviceFromClass(struct CLASS_DEVICE *dev)
00337 {
00338         int id;
00339 
00340         for (id = 0; id < idx; ++id){
00341                 struct Acq200Device* acq200_device = devices[id];
00342                 if (dev == devices[id]->class_dev){
00343                         return acq200_device;
00344                 }
00345         }
00346         
00347         return 0;
00348 }

00350 
00351 static void get_max_buf(struct DmaBuf *dma_buf, int max_order)
00352 {
00353         void *buf;
00354         int order;
00355 
00356         for (order = max_order; order >= 0; --order){
00357                 buf = (void*)__get_free_pages(GFP_KERNEL|GFP_DMA32|__GFP_NOWARN, order);
00358                 if (buf){
00359                         dbg(1, "%2d [0x%08lx bytes] SUCCESS",
00360                                order, ORDER2LEN(order));
00361                         dma_buf->va = buf;
00362                         dma_buf->order = order;
00363                         return;
00364                 }else{
00365                         dbg(2, "%2d [0x%08lx bytes] FAIL",
00366                                order, ORDER2LEN(order));
00367                 }
00368         }
00369         assert(0);
00370 }
00371 
00372 static void alloc_max_buf(
00373         struct device *dev, 
00374         struct DmaBuf *dma_buf, 
00375         enum dma_data_direction dir,
00376         int max_order)
00377 {
00378         get_max_buf(dma_buf, max_order);
00379         dma_buf->pa = dma_map_single(
00380                         dev, dma_buf->va, dma_buf_len(dma_buf), dir);
00381 }
00382 
00383 static void alloc_llhost_buf(
00384         struct device *dev,
00385         struct DmaBuf *dma_buf)
00386 {
00387         dma_addr_t pa;
00388         dma_buf->va = dma_alloc_coherent(dev, PAGE_SIZE, &pa,
00389                                 GFP_KERNEL|GFP_DMA32|__GFP_NOWARN);
00390         dma_buf->order = 0;
00391         dma_buf->pa = pa;
00392 }

00394 static 
00395 struct Acq200Path *acq200_createPath(
00396         struct inode* inode, struct Acq200Device *device) 
00397 {
00398         struct Acq200Path *path = 
00399                 kmalloc(sizeof(struct Acq200Path), GFP_KERNEL);
00400 
00401         memset(path, 0, PATH_HEAD);
00402 
00403         if (path != 0){
00404                 path->device = device;
00405                 path->minor = MINOR(inode->i_rdev);
00406                 path->dma_buf = device->dma_buf;
00407                 path->llhost_dma_buf = device->llhost_dma_buf;
00408                 init_waitqueue_head(&path->return_waitq);
00409         }
00410         return path;
00411 }
00412 
00413 static void acq200_deletePath(struct Acq200Path *path)
00414 {
00415         kfree(path);
00416 }
00417 static struct Acq200Device *acq200_lookup_device(struct inode* inode)
00418 {
00419         int major = MAJOR(inode->i_rdev);
00420         int isearch;
00421 
00422         dbg(2, "major %d", major);
00423 
00424         for (isearch = 0; isearch < idx; ++isearch){
00425                 struct Acq200Device* device = devices[isearch];
00426 
00427                 assert(device != 0);
00428 
00429                 if (device->ldev.major == major){
00430                         return device;
00431                 }
00432         }
00433 
00434         assert(0);
00435         return 0;
00436 }
00437 
00438 
00439 /* set a BIG timeout to handle case of timer ints disabled */
00440 #define BIGTIME 0x7fffffff   
00441 
00442 static int acq200_poll_response(
00443         struct Acq200Device* device, long timeout)
00444 {
00445         unsigned itimeout;
00446         unsigned mask = BP_CI_ACK;
00447         unsigned long end = jiffies + timeout;
00448 
00449         for (itimeout = 0; itimeout != BIGTIME; ++itimeout){
00450                 u32 ucommand = ioread32(&MBOX(device, BP_MB_COMMAND));
00451 
00452                 if ((ucommand&mask) != 0){
00453                         return 0;
00454                 }else{
00455                         if (itimeout < 4){
00456                                 dbg(2, "call to schedule STUBBED\n");
00457                         }else{
00458                                 schedule();
00459                         }
00460                 }
00461                 if (time_after(jiffies, end)){
00462                         break;
00463                 }
00464         }
00465  
00466         return -ETIMEDOUT;
00467 }
00468 
00469 static void fill_ramp(int *data, int len)
00470 {
00471         int ilen = len / sizeof(int);
00472         int ii;
00473         unsigned id = idx << 28;
00474 
00475         for (ii = 0; ii < ilen; ++ii){
00476                 data[ii] = id | ii;
00477         }
00478 }
00479 
00480 
00481 
00482 static struct Acq200Device *acq200_device_create(struct pci_dev *pci_dev)
00483 {
00484         struct Acq200Device *device =
00485                 kmalloc(sizeof(struct Acq200Device), GFP_KERNEL);
00486 
00487         assert(device);
00488         memset(device, 0, sizeof(struct Acq200Device));
00489         assert(idx < MAXDEV);
00490 
00491         devices[idx] = device;
00492         device->pci_dev = pci_dev;
00493         device->idx = idx++;
00494         sprintf(device->ldev.drv_name, "acq200.%d", device->idx );
00495 
00496         alloc_llhost_buf(&pci_dev->dev, &device->llhost_dma_buf);
00497 
00498         alloc_max_buf(&pci_dev->dev, &device->dma_buf, DMA_BIDIRECTIONAL, 
00499                         COMMSBUF_ORDER);
00500         fill_ramp(device->dma_buf.va, dma_buf_len(&device->dma_buf));
00501 
00502         acq200_map_pci_memory(device);
00503 
00507         device->ram.va = device->dma_buf.va;
00508         device->ram.pa = device->dma_buf.pa;
00509 
00510         init_MUTEX(&device->mbox_sync.mutex);
00511         init_MUTEX(&device->clients.mutex);
00512         init_MUTEX(&device->buffer_AB_busy_mutex);
00513         init_waitqueue_head(&device->mbox_sync.waitq);
00514         init_waitqueue_head(&device->m_dpd.aux_waitq);
00515         streamBufInit(&device->streambuf);
00516         tasklet_init(
00517                 &device->m_dpd.streaming_isr_tasklet, 
00518                 acq200_streaming_isr_bh, 
00519                 (unsigned long) device);
00520 
00521         rchInit(device, 0);
00522         acq200_pool_create(device);
00523         return device;
00524 }
00525 
00526 static void __kbuf_free(struct DmaBuf *dma_buf)
00527 {
00528         if (dma_buf->va != 0){
00529                 __free_pages(dma_buf->va, dma_buf->order);
00530         }
00531 }
00532 static void acq200_device_free(struct Acq200Device *device)
00533 {
00534         acq200_pool_delete(device);
00535         acq200_unmap_pci_memory(device);
00536 
00537         __free_pages(device->llhost_dma_buf.va, device->llhost_dma_buf.order);
00538         __kbuf_free(&device->dma_buf);
00539         __kbuf_free(&device->AB[0]);
00540         __kbuf_free(&device->AB[1]);
00541         kfree(device);
00542 }

00545 
00546 static ssize_t acq200_read (
00547         struct file* file, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* posp)
00548 {
00549         char myline[80];
00550         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00551         int pos = (int)*posp;
00552 
00553         int len = sprintf(myline, "BIGBUF: pa=0x%08x len=0x%08lx\n",
00554                           device->dma_buf.pa, 
00555                           ORDER2LEN(device->dma_buf.order));
00556 
00557         if (pos < len){
00558                 int rc;
00559 
00560                 len = min((int)count, len - pos);
00561                 rc = copy_to_user(buf, myline + pos, len);
00562                 if (rc != 0){
00563                         err("returning EFAULT");
00564                         return -EFAULT;
00565                 }
00566                 *posp += len;
00567                 return len;
00568         }else{
00569                 return 0;
00570         }
00571 }
00572 
00573 static ssize_t acq200_write (
00574         struct file *file, const char *buf, size_t count, loff_t * posp)
00575 // write data as if from debug port
00576 {       
00577         dbg(1, "count %d", (int)count);
00578 
00579         return 0;
00580 }

00582 
00583 
00584 #define MBX_READ 1
00585 
00586 static void acq200_mbox_dbg(struct MailboxControl *mbc, int read)
00587 {
00588         u32* regs = read? mbc->mbxr: mbc->mbxw;
00589         unsigned mask = read? MBC_FROM_MBXR(mbc):  MBC_FROM_MBXW(mbc);
00590 
00591         info("%5s: [%x] %08x %08x %08x %08x", 
00592                 read? "READ": "WRITE",
00593                 mask,
00594              regs[0], regs[1], regs[2], regs[3]);
00595 }
00596 
00597 static int acq200_ioctl_read_mbox(
00598         struct Acq200Device *device, struct MailboxControl *mbc)
00599 {
00600         unsigned read_mask = MBC_FROM_MBXR(mbc);
00601         int ibox;
00602         
00603         for (ibox = MBOX_NUM; ibox-- > 0; ){
00604                 if (((1<<ibox)&read_mask) != 0){
00605                         mbc->mbxr[ibox] = MBOX_READ(device, ibox);
00606                 }
00607         }
00608 
00609         if (acq200_debug_mbox){
00610                 acq200_mbox_dbg(mbc, MBX_READ);
00611         }
00612 
00613         return 0;
00614 }
00615 
00616 static int _acq200_ioctl_write_mbox(
00617         struct Acq200Device *device, struct MailboxControl *mbc)
00618 {
00619         unsigned write_mask = MBC_FROM_MBXW(mbc);
00620         int ibox;
00621 
00622         device->mbox_sync.response_received = 0;
00623 
00624         if (acq200_debug_mbox){
00625                 acq200_mbox_dbg(mbc, !MBX_READ);
00626         }
00627         for (ibox = MBOX_NUM; ibox-- > 0; ){
00628                 if (((1<<ibox)&write_mask) != 0){
00629                         MBOX_WRITE(device, ibox, mbc->mbxw[ibox]);
00630                 }
00631         }
00632         return 0;
00633 }
00634 
00635 #ifdef DANGEROUS
00636 static int acq200_ioctl_write_mbox(
00637         struct Acq200Device *device, struct MailboxControl *mbc)
00638 {
00639         if (down_interruptible(&device->mbox_sync.mutex)){
00640                 return -ERESTARTSYS;
00641         }
00642         _acq200_ioctl_write_mbox(device, mbc);
00643 
00644         up(&device->mbox_sync.mutex);
00645         return 0;
00646 }
00647 #endif
00648 
00649 static int acq200_ioctl_wbr_mbox(
00650         struct Acq200Device *device, struct MailboxControl *mbc)
00652 {
00653         long timeout = mbc->mbc_flags&MBC_FLAGS_TO;
00654         int rc = 0;
00655 
00656         if (down_interruptible(&device->mbox_sync.mutex)){
00657                 return -ERESTARTSYS;
00658         }       
00659 
00660         _acq200_ioctl_write_mbox(device, mbc);
00661 
00662         if (device->mbox_sync.using_interrupt){
00663                 if (timeout == MBC_FLAGS_TO_FOREVER){
00664                         rc = wait_event_interruptible(
00665                                 device->mbox_sync.waitq, 
00666                                 RESPONSE_RECEIVED(device));
00667                 }else{
00668                         rc = wait_event_interruptible_timeout(
00669                                 device->mbox_sync.waitq, 
00670                                 RESPONSE_RECEIVED(device),
00671                                 timeout);
00672                         if (rc == 0){
00673                                 rc = -ETIMEDOUT;
00674                         }else if (rc > 0){
00675                                 rc = 0;         /* ticks left == OK */
00676                         }
00677                 }
00678 
00679                 dbg(1, "back from wait rc:%d", rc);
00680         }else{
00681                 rc = acq200_poll_response(device, timeout);
00682         }
00683 
00684         acq200_ioctl_read_mbox(device, mbc);
00685         up(&device->mbox_sync.mutex);
00686 
00687         return rc;
00688         
00689 }
00690         
00691 
00692 static int acq200_mbox_ioctl(
00693         struct file *filp,
00694         unsigned long arg,
00695         int (*action)(struct Acq200Device *, struct MailboxControl *))
00696 {
00697         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(filp);
00698         struct Acq200Path *path = PD(filp);
00699         struct MailboxControl *umbc = (struct MailboxControl*)arg;
00700         struct MailboxControl kmbc;
00701         int rc;
00702 
00703         dbg(1, "01 action %p", action);
00704 
00705         rc = copy_from_user(&kmbc, umbc, sizeof(kmbc)); 
00706         if (rc != 0){
00707                 err("returning EFAULT");
00708                 return -EFAULT;
00709         }
00710 
00712         if ((kmbc.mbc_flags&MBC_FLAGS_ONRELEASE) != 0){
00713                 memcpy(&path->mbc_on_release, &kmbc, sizeof(kmbc));
00714                 return 0;
00715         }
00716 
00717         rc = action(device, &kmbc);
00718 
00719         rc = copy_to_user(umbc, &kmbc, sizeof(kmbc));
00720         if (rc != 0){
00721                 err("returning EFAULT");
00722                 return -EFAULT;
00723         }
00724 
00725         dbg(1, "99 ret %d", rc);
00726         return rc;
00727 }
00728 
00729 
00730 int acq200_ioctl (struct inode *inode, struct file *filp,
00731                         unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00732 {
00733         dbg(1, "cmd 0x%08x", cmd);
00734 
00735         switch(cmd){
00736 
00737         case ACQ200_MBOX_IOR:
00738                 return acq200_mbox_ioctl(filp, arg, acq200_ioctl_read_mbox);
00739 #ifdef DANGEROUS
00740         case ACQ200_MBOX_IOW:
00741                 return acq200_mbox_ioctl(filp, arg, acq200_ioctl_write_mbox);
00742 #endif
00743         case ACQ200_MBOX_IOWR:
00744                 return acq200_mbox_ioctl(filp, arg, acq200_ioctl_wbr_mbox);
00745         case ACQ32_IOG_PCIREGS_OFFSET: {
00746                 struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(filp);
00747                 unsigned ba = device->csr.pa&(PAGE_SIZE-1);
00748                 ba += 0x10;
00749                 put_user(ba, (unsigned*)arg);         
00750                 return 0;
00751         }
00752         case ACQ32_IOS_INTS_DISABLE:
00753                 return acq200_intsDisable((unsigned)arg);       
00754         case ACQ32_IOS_INTS_ENABLE:
00755                 return acq200_intsEnable((unsigned)arg);
00756         default:                        
00757                 dbg(2, "wanted either 0x%08lx or 0x%08lx", 
00758                     (unsigned long)ACQ200_MBOX_IOR, 
00759                     (unsigned long)ACQ200_MBOX_IOWR);
00760                 return -ENOTTY;
00761         }
00762 }
00763 
00764 int acq200_sendCommand(struct Acq200Device *device, u32 command)
00766 {
00767         struct MailboxControl mbc = {
00768                 .mbc_flags = DEFTO | MBC_TO_MBXW(1<<BP_MB_COMMAND) |
00769                 MBC_TO_MBXR(0xf)
00770         };
00771         mbc.mbxw[BP_MB_COMMAND] = command | BP_CI_DONE | BP_CI_COMMAND;
00772         return acq200_ioctl_wbr_mbox(device, &mbc);
00773 }
00774 
00775 int acq200_sendCommandA3A4(
00776         struct Acq200Device *device, u32 command,
00777         u32 a3, u32 a4)
00779 {
00780         struct MailboxControl mbc = {
00781                 .mbc_flags = DEFTO | 
00782                 MBC_TO_MBXW((1<<BP_MB_COMMAND)|(1<<BP_MB_A3)|(1<<BP_MB_A4)) |
00783                 MBC_TO_MBXR(0xf)
00784         };
00785         mbc.mbxw[BP_MB_COMMAND] = command | 
00786                 BP_CI_DONE | BP_CI_COMMAND | BP_MB_A3 | BP_MB_A4;
00787         mbc.mbxw[BP_MB_A3] = a3;
00788         mbc.mbxw[BP_MB_A4] = a4;
00789 
00790         return acq200_ioctl_wbr_mbox(device, &mbc);
00791 }
00792 
00793 int acq200_sendQuery( 
00794     struct Acq200Device* device, 
00795     unsigned command, 
00796     unsigned* a1,
00797     unsigned* a2,
00798     unsigned* a3,
00799     unsigned* a4
00800     )
00802 {
00803         struct MailboxControl mbc = { 
00804                 .mbc_flags = DEFTO | 
00805                 MBC_TO_MBXW(1<<BP_MB_COMMAND)|
00806                 MBC_TO_MBXR(1<<BP_MB_COMMAND)
00807         };
00808         int rc;
00809 
00810         if (a3 != NULL_A3){
00811                 mbc.mbc_flags |= MBC_TO_MBXR(1<<BP_MB_A3);
00812         }
00813         if (a4 != NULL_A4){
00814                 mbc.mbc_flags |= MBC_TO_MBXR(1<<BP_MB_A4);
00815         }
00816 
00817         mbc.mbxw[BP_MB_COMMAND] = command | BP_CI_QUERY | BP_CI_DONE;
00818     
00819         rc = acq200_ioctl_wbr_mbox(device, &mbc);
00820 
00821         if (rc == 0){
00822                 if (a1) *a1 = BP_GET_A1(mbc.mbxr[BP_MB_COMMAND]);
00823                 if (a2) *a2 = BP_GET_A2(mbc.mbxr[BP_MB_COMMAND]);
00824                 if (a3) *a3 = mbc.mbxr[BP_MB_A3];
00825                 if (a4) *a4 = mbc.mbxr[BP_MB_A4];
00826         }
00827 
00828         return rc;
00829 }
00830 
00831 
00832 
00833 int acq200_handle_incoming_message(struct Acq200Device *device)
00834 /* handle message - call from thread level */
00835 {
00836         u32 mfa = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_OQP));
00837 
00838         dbg(3, "mfa %08x", mfa );
00839         if (mfa == 0xffffffff || mfa == 0){
00840                 return 0;
00841         }else{
00842                 device->m_dpd.bad_mfa_count = 0;
00843 
00844                 acq200_consume_i2o(device, mfa);
00845                 return 1;
00846         }
00847 }
00848 
00849 
00850 irqreturn_t acq200_incoming_message_isr(struct Acq200Device *device)
00851 /* handle message - call from interrupt level */
00852 {
00853         u32 mfa = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_OQP));
00854 
00855         dbg(1, "mfa %08x", mfa );
00856         /* get out of jail free trap */
00857         if (mfa == 0xffffffff || mfa == 0){
00858                 err("%d bad mfa 0x%08x", device->idx, mfa);
00859                 if (++device->m_dpd.bad_mfa_count > BAD_MFA_THRESHOLD){
00860                         u32 mask = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_OIMR));
00861                         mask |= ACQ200_OISR_OPQI;
00862                         writel(mask, CSR(device, ACQ200_OIMR));
00863                         err(" bad mfa 0x%08x masking ints to get back in game",
00864                             mfa);
00865                 }
00866                 return IRQ_NONE;
00867         }else{
00868                 device->m_dpd.bad_mfa_count = 0;
00869                 acq200_consume_i2o(device, mfa);
00870                 return IRQ_HANDLED;
00871         }
00872 }
00873 
00874 
00875 static irqreturn_t acq200_doorbell_isr(
00876         struct Acq200Device *device, u32 doorbell)
00877 {
00878         dbg(1, "%s doorbell 0x%08x wakeup %p", 
00879             device->ldev.drv_name, doorbell, &device->mbox_sync.waitq);
00880 
00881         device->mbox_sync.response_received = 1;
00882         dbg(1, "about to wake up");
00883         wake_up_interruptible(&device->mbox_sync.waitq);
00884         dbg(1, "wake done - do your worst");
00885         return IRQ_HANDLED;
00886 }
00887 
00888 static irqreturn_t acq200_isr(int irq, void* dev_id)
00889 {
00890         static int bad_report;
00891 
00892         struct Acq200Device* device = (struct Acq200Device*)dev_id;
00893         u32 status = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_OISR));
00894 /* OIMR bits not interesting, and masked so not actually an interrupt */
00895 #define IRQ_IGNORE (ACQ200_OISR_OM_0|ACQ200_OISR_OM_1)
00896 
00897         if ((status & ~IRQ_IGNORE) == 0){
00898                 if ((status & IRQ_IGNORE) != 0){
00900                         writel(status,CSR(device, IRQ_IGNORE)); 
00901                 }
00902                 return IRQ_NONE;
00903         }else if (status&ACQ200_OISR_OPQI){ 
00904                 dbg(1, "irq %d %s %s", irq, device->ldev.drv_name, "message");
00905                 bad_report = 0;
00906                 device->interrupt_count[0]++;
00907                 return acq200_incoming_message_isr(device);
00908         }else if (status&ACQ200_OISR_ODI){
00909                 u32 doorbell = readl(CSR(device, ACQ200_ODR));
00910 
00911                 dbg(1, "irq %d %s %s 0x%08x",
00912                     irq, device->ldev.drv_name, "doorbell", doorbell);
00913 
00914                 writel(doorbell, CSR(device, ACQ200_ODR));
00915                 bad_report = 0;
00916                 device->interrupt_count[1]++;
00917                 return acq200_doorbell_isr(device, doorbell);
00918         }else{ 
00919                 dbg(1, "irq %d %s %s", irq, device->ldev.drv_name, "bad");
00920                 if ((bad_report&0xffff) == 0){
00921                         err( "IRQ %d don't like this status 0x%08x", 
00922                              irq, status );
00923                 }
00924                 writel(status,CSR(device, ACQ200_OISR));
00925                 bad_report++;
00926                 device->interrupt_count[2]++;
00927                 return IRQ_HANDLED;
00928         }
00929 }
00930 
00931 #define MYTURN 1
00932 
00933 int acq200_onFirstClientOpenAB(struct Acq200Device *device)
00934 {
00935         int rc = 0;
00936 
00937         device->i2o_backstop =  kthread_run(
00938                 i2o_missed_int_checker, 
00939                 device, 
00940                 "acq200_i2o.%d", 
00941                 device->idx);
00942 
00943         return rc;
00944 }
00945 
00946 
00947 int acq200_onLastClientReleaseAB(struct Acq200Device *device)
00948 {
00949         int rc = 0;
00950         kthread_stop(device->i2o_backstop);
00951         return rc;
00952 }
00953 static int onOpen(struct Acq200Path *path)
00954 {
00955         struct Acq200Device *device = path->device;
00956         int rc = 0;
00957 
00958         if (down_interruptible(&device->clients.mutex)){
00959                 return -ERESTARTSYS;
00960         }
00961         if (++device->clients.count == 1){
00962                 rc = acq200_onFirstClientOpenAB(device);
00963         }
00964         up(&device->clients.mutex);
00965 
00966         return rc;      
00967 }
00968 
00969 static int onRelease(struct Acq200Path *path)
00970 {
00971         struct Acq200Device *device = path->device;
00972         int rc = 0;
00973 
00974         dbg(1, "into critical ...");
00975         if (down_interruptible(&device->clients.mutex)){
00976                 err("possible corrupt mutex on interruption");
00977         }
00978         if (device->clients.count == 1){
00979                 rc = acq200_onLastClientReleaseAB(device);
00980         }
00981         --device->clients.count;
00982         up(&device->clients.mutex);
00983 
00984         dbg(1, "clients.count %d", device->clients.count);
00985         return rc;      
00986 }
00987 
00988 
00989 
00990 int acq200_bridge_openAB(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00991 {
00992         struct Acq200Device *device = DEV(file);
00993         struct Acq200Path *path = PD(file);
00994 
00995         if (device->AB[0].va == 0){
00996                 struct device *dev = &device->pci_dev->dev;
00997                 /* allocate buffer A, buffer B */
00998                 alloc_max_buf(dev, &device->AB[0], DMA_FROM_DEVICE, 
00999                                 acq200_AB_dmabuf_max_order);
01000                 alloc_max_buf(dev, &device->AB[1], DMA_FROM_DEVICE,
01001                                 acq200_AB_dmabuf_max_order);
01002         }
01003 
01004         copyDmaBuf2IoMapping(&path->bufferMappings[0], &device->AB[0]);
01005         copyDmaBuf2IoMapping(&path->bufferMappings[1], &device->AB[1]);
01006         onOpen(PD(file));
01007         return 0;
01008 }
01009 int acq200_bridge_releaseAB (
01010         struct inode *inode, struct file *file
01011         )
01012 {
01013         onRelease(PD(file));
01014         return acq200_bridge_release(inode, file);
01015 }
01016 
01017 int acq200_ioctlAB (struct inode *inode, struct file *file,
01018                         unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
01019 {
01020         dbg(1, "cmd %d valid %lu", cmd, (unsigned long)ACQ200_BUFFER_AB_IOWR);
01021 
01022         switch(cmd){
01023         case ACQ200_BUFFER_AB_IOWR: {
01024                 struct Acq200Path* path = PD(file);
01025                 struct BufferAB_Ops ab_ops;
01026                 int rc;
01027 
01028                 if (down_interruptible(&path->device->buffer_AB_busy_mutex)){
01029                         return -ERESTARTSYS;
01030                 }else{
01031                         path->has_AB_busy_mutex = 1;
01032                 }
01033                 COPY_FROM_USER(&ab_ops, (void*)arg, BUFFERAB_OPS_SZ);
01034                 rc = acq200_bufferABaction(file, &ab_ops);
01035 
01036                 up(&path->device->buffer_AB_busy_mutex);
01037                 path->has_AB_busy_mutex = 0;
01038 
01039                 if (rc == 0){
01040                         COPY_TO_USER((void*)arg, &ab_ops, BUFFERAB_OPS_SZ);
01041                 }
01042                 return rc;
01043         }
01044         default:
01045                 return -ENOTTY;
01046         }
01047 }
01048 
01049 
01050 int acq200_open (struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01051 {
01052         static struct file_operations acq200_fops = {
01053                 .read = acq200_read,
01054                 .write = acq200_write,
01055                 .release = acq200_release,
01056                 .ioctl = acq200_ioctl,
01057                 .mmap = acq200_mmap_host
01058         };
01059         static struct file_operations acq200_llhost_fops = {
01060                 .read = acq200_read,
01061                 .write = acq200_write,
01062                 .release = acq200_release,
01063                 .ioctl = acq200_ioctl,
01064                 .mmap = acq200_mmap_llhost
01065         };
01066         static struct file_operations acq200_mbox_fops = {
01067                 .read = acq200_read,
01068                 .write = acq200_write,
01069                 .release = acq200_release,
01070                 .ioctl = acq200_ioctl,
01071                 .mmap = acq200_mmap_mbox
01072         };
01073         static struct file_operations acq200_bridge_fops = {
01074                 .read = acq200_bridge_read,
01075                 .write = acq200_bridge_write,
01076                 .release = acq200_bridge_release
01077         };
01078         static struct file_operations acq200_bridge_AB_fops = {
01079                 .open = acq200_bridge_openAB,
01080                 .read = acq200_bridge_readAB,
01081                 .ioctl = acq200_ioctlAB,
01082                 .mmap = acq200_mmapAB,
01083                 .write = acq200_bridge_write,
01084                 .release = acq200_bridge_releaseAB
01085         };
01086 #define RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(newfops)                    \
01087         file->f_op = &newfops;                          \
01088         goto return_open_take_busy;
01089 
01090 #define RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS_NOSEM(newfops)              \
01091         file->f_op = &newfops;                          \
01092         goto return_open;
01093 
01094         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookup_device(inode);
01095         struct Acq200Path *path;
01096 
01097         dbg(1, "01");
01098 
01099         if (device == 0){
01100                 return -ENODEV;
01101         }
01102 
01103         path = acq200_createPath(inode, device);
01104         SET_PATH(file, path);
01105 
01106         if (DEVRAW(path->minor)){
01107                 RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS_NOSEM(acq200_mbox_fops);
01108         }else if (BIGDUMPDEV(path->minor)){
01109                 RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS_NOSEM(acq200_fops);
01110         }else if (LLHOSTDEV(path->minor)){
01111                 RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS_NOSEM(acq200_llhost_fops);
01112         }else if (IS_CHANNEL_DEV(path->minor)){
01113                 if (path->minor > 96){
01114                         file->f_op = &acq200_bridge_AB_fops;
01115                         goto return_open;
01116                 }else{
01117                         RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(acq200_bridge_fops);
01118                 }
01119         }else if (IS_FILE(path->minor)){
01120                 RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(acq200_bridge_fops);
01121         }else if (IS_RSH(path->minor)){
01122                 RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(acq200_bridge_fops);
01123         }else{
01124                 /* placeholder */
01125                 RETURN_OPEN_NEWFOPS(acq200_fops);
01126         }
01127 
01128         return -ENODEV;
01129 
01130 return_open_take_busy:
01131         if (down_interruptible(&device->buffer_AB_busy_mutex)){
01132                 return -ERESTARTSYS;
01133         }else{
01134                 dbg(1, "down");
01135                 path->has_AB_busy_mutex = 1;
01136         }
01137 
01138 return_open:
01139         if (file->f_op->open != 0){
01140                 return file->f_op->open(inode, file);
01141         }else{
01142                 return 0;
01143         }
01144 }
01145 
01146 int acq200_release (struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
01147 {
01148         struct Acq200Path* path = PD(file);
01149 
01150         if (path->has_AB_busy_mutex){
01151                 dbg(1, "up");
01152                 up(&path->device->buffer_AB_busy_mutex);
01153         }
01154         if ((path->mbc_on_release.mbc_flags&MBC_FLAGS_ONRELEASE) != 0){
01155                 path->mbc_on_release.mbc_flags&= ~MBC_FLAGS_ONRELEASE;
01156                 acq200_ioctl_wbr_mbox(DEV(file), &path->mbc_on_release);
01157         }
01158         acq200_deletePath(path);
01159         dbg(1, "01");
01160         return 0;
01161 }
01162 
01163 
01164 static int __devinit
01165 acq200_device_init(struct Acq200Device *device)
01166 {
01167         static struct file_operations acq200_default_fops = {
01168                 .open = acq200_open,
01169                 .release = acq200_release,
01170                 .ioctl = acq200_ioctl,
01171         };
01172         int rc;
01173 
01174 
01175         rc = pci_enable_device(device->pci_dev);
01176         if (rc != 0){
01177                 err("pci_enable_device FAILED returning %d", rc);
01178                 return rc;
01179         }
01180 
01181         slots[device->idx] = acq200_get_cpci_slot(device->pci_dev);
01182         
01183         rc = register_chrdev(device->ldev.major = 0, 
01184                              device->ldev.drv_name, 
01185                              &acq200_default_fops);
01186 
01187         if (rc < 0){
01188                 err( "can't get major %d", device->ldev.major );
01189                 return rc;
01190         }else{
01191                 device->ldev.major = rc;
01192                 info( "device major set %d\n", device->ldev.major );
01193         }
01194 
01195 /*
01196  * if interrupts are requested globally, AND the board is wanting an interrupt,
01197  * ask Linux for the use thereof
01198  */
01199         if (acq200_use_interrupts != 0 && device->pci_dev->irq != 0){
01200                 rc = request_irq( 
01201                         device->pci_dev->irq, 
01202                         ACQ200_ISR, 
01203                         IRQF_SHARED,
01204                         device->ldev.drv_name, 
01205                         device
01206                 );
01207 
01208                 if (rc != 0){
01209                         err("request_irq %d FAILED", device->pci_dev->irq);
01210                         return rc;
01211                 }
01212         }
01213 
01214         if (device->mbox_sync.using_interrupt){
01215                 rc = acq200_sendCommand(device, 
01216                            BP_SET_FUNCODE(BP_FC_SET_INTERRUPTS)+BP_SET_A1(3));
01217                 if (rc != 0){
01218                         err("BP_FC_SET_INTERRUPTS failed %d", rc);
01219                         return rc;
01220                 }
01221         }
01222 
01223         if (device->completed_onetime_setups == 0){
01224                 unsigned funcode = 
01225                         BP_SET_FUNCODE(BP_FC_SET_HOST_DMABUF)|
01226                         BP_SET_A1(NMAPPINGS);
01227                 rc = acq200_sendCommandA3A4(device,
01228                         funcode,
01229                         (u32)device->dma_buf.pa, 
01230                         dma_buf_len(&device->dma_buf));
01231                 device->completed_onetime_setups = 1;
01232 
01233                 if (rc != 0){   
01234                         err("BP_FC_SET_HOST_DMABUF failed %d", rc);
01235                         return rc;
01236                 }
01237 
01238                 rc = acq200_getAvailableChannels(device);
01239         }
01240 
01241 
01242         acq200_create_sysfs_device(&device->pci_dev->dev);
01243 
01244         device->class_dev = CLASS_DEVICE_CREATE(
01245                 acq200_device_class,                    /* cls */
01246                 NULL,                                   /* cls_parent */
01247                 device->idx,                            /* "devt" */
01248                 &device->pci_dev->dev,                  /* device */
01249                 "acq200.%d", device->idx);               /* fmt, idx */
01250 
01251         acq200_create_sysfs_class(device);
01252 
01253         spin_lock_init(&device->bkl.lock);
01254         return rc;      
01255 }

01258 static void acq200_set_dev_type(
01259         struct Acq200Device* device, const struct pci_device_id *ent)
01260 {
01261         if (IS_ACQ196(ent)){
01262                 device->card_type = DEV_TYPE_ACQ196;
01263                 sprintf(device->model_name, "%s", "acq196");
01264         }else{
01265                 device->card_type = DEV_TYPE_ACQ216;
01266                 sprintf(device->model_name, "%s", "acq216");
01267         }
01268 }
01269 
01270 
01271 static int __devinit
01272 acq200_probe(struct pci_dev *dev, const struct pci_device_id *ent)
01273 {
01274         struct Acq200Device* device = acq200_device_create(dev);
01275 
01276         acq200_set_dev_type(device, ent);
01277         return acq200_device_init(device);
01278 }
01279 
01280 
01281 static void acq200_remove (struct pci_dev *dev)
01282 {
01283         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookupDevice(&dev->dev);
01284         if (device != 0){
01285 
01286                 int used_interrupts = device->mbox_sync.using_interrupt != 0;
01287 
01288                 if (used_interrupts){
01289                         free_irq(device->pci_dev->irq, device);
01290                         device->mbox_sync.using_interrupt = 0;
01291                 }
01292 
01293                 dbg(1, "free_irq %s", used_interrupts? "YES": "NO");
01294 
01295                 acq200_remove_sysfs_class(device);
01296                 acq200_remove_sysfs_device(&device->pci_dev->dev);
01297                 device_destroy(acq200_device_class, device->idx);
01298 
01299                 unregister_chrdev(
01300                                 device->ldev.major, device->ldev.drv_name);
01301                 acq200_device_free(device);
01302         }
01303 }
01304 
01305 
01306 /*
01307  *
01308  * { Vendor ID, Device ID, SubVendor ID, SubDevice ID,
01309  *   Class, Class Mask, String Index }
01310  */
01311 static struct pci_device_id acq200_pci_tbl[] __devinitdata = {
01312         {PCI_VENDOR_ID_HINT, 0x0029, PCI_ANY_ID, PCI_ANY_ID, 0, 0, 0},
01313         {PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL, 0x0318, PCI_ANY_ID, PCI_ANY_ID, 0, 0, 0},
01314         {PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL, 0x0319, PCI_ANY_ID, PCI_ANY_ID, 0, 0, 0},
01315         { }
01316 };
01317 static struct pci_driver acq200_driver = {
01318         .name     = acq200_driver_name,
01319         .id_table = acq200_pci_tbl,
01320         .probe    = acq200_probe,
01321         .remove   = __devexit_p(acq200_remove),
01322 #ifdef PGMCOMOUT
01323         /* Power Managment Hooks */
01324 #ifdef CONFIG_PM
01325         .suspend  = acq200_suspend,
01326         .resume   = acq200_resume
01327 #endif
01328 #endif
01329 };

01334 static int __init acq200_init( void )
01335 {
01336         int rc;
01337 
01338         acq200_device_class = class_create(THIS_MODULE, "acqX00");
01339         rc = pci_register_driver(&acq200_driver);
01340         dbg(1, "pci_register_driver() returned %d", rc );
01341         return 0;
01342 }

01344 int acq200_init_module(void)
01345 {
01346         info("%s\n%s\n%s\n%s", 
01347              acq200_driver_name, acq200__driver_string,
01348              acq200__driver_version, acq200__copyright);
01349         acq200_init();
01350         return 0;
01351 }
01352 
01353 void acq200_exit_module(void)
01354 {
01355         if (!idx) return;
01356         pci_unregister_driver(&acq200_driver);
01357         class_destroy(acq200_device_class);
01358 }
